title: Tahm kench is so much fun to go against!! ^_^
body:
I think tahm kench is absolutely the most exciting character to go against! He is a support tank that does insanely awesome massive damage!! It's great that he can hit you three times and carry you with him because he cares for you that much! and then just one shot spits you out, I have so much fun when that happens I cry tears of happiness. Another thing that is great about tahm is his passive that gives him 2 life bars! O man if I didn't have fun draining his life the first time i get to do a second time! haha but the great part is he gets away yay!! I slam my fists on my desk in celebration!!!!! =D and here is the best part you can't get away from him between his Q and R. It feels good that he cares so much he doesn't want to go anywhere without you! I think tahm kench is a well made character good job to whoever riot employee made him!!! you're such a good designer you really know how to create a well made completely fair and balanced character good job!!!
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

replies.body: The passive aggressive is real in this thread. I don't like Tahm either.

> his passive that gives him 2 life bars! O man if I didn't have fun draining his life the first time i get to do a second time! haha but the great part is he gets away yay!!
 
Lost it here xDDDDD
Inb4 rito doesnt take this as satire

*Looks at post title*
"Hm... more self praise..."
*Reads post*
"Hey Meddler! We made somebody happy with the changes!"
Meddler: "...why should I give two shits what a player thinks?"
"Uh... good point, boss."
Meddler: "Why are you even on the boards?!? FIND MORE WAYS TO BUFF LEE SIN, DAMN IT!"
Except Lee Sin is probably the champion with the longest consecutive nerfs in League. Even Rengar gets a slight rework inbetween his massive nerfs

> [{quoted}](name=KetiaX,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=T4RbHftx,comment-id=0000000100000000,timestamp=2016-02-05T07:23:15.608+0000)
>
> Except Lee Sin is probably the champion with the longest consecutive nerfs in League. Even Rengar gets a slight rework inbetween his massive nerfs

I sincerely doubt that. I think coming out of season 2, every last part Hecarim's kit was hit and his itemization nerfed or eliminated. Several release level champs got similar treatments-- Zyra comes to mind.

My only objection to Tahm is his ult passive. Why does a support get the best on hit passive on a tank?
Yeah, every single ability was nerfed even his passive :D.

Not sure about Hecarim, I never play him since his release (probably only once ever), so can't say much.

But for Lee Sin, every single part of his kit has got some hit. First Q base damage, second Q base and percentage damage, W shield, W lifesteal and spellvamp, W cooldown, E damage, E attack speed slow, R scaling damage, and passive AS, all of them has got hit. At least Zyra's W and passive never got touched.

Tahm support seems fine for me since he doesn't have enough gold to buy tankiness, but I do agree top Tahm is obnoxious.

Tahm was fine at his release state. Then they overbuffed him just so that people would start picking him (especially in LCS).
The same is going to happen to Illaoi. 

Meanwhile Vel'Koz cries in a corner.

> [{quoted}](name=TheGoddessDiana,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=T4RbHftx,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-02-04T09:11:58.841+0000)
>
> Tahm was fine at his release state. Then they overbuffed him just so that people would start picking him (especially in LCS).
> The same is going to happen to Illaoi. 
> 
> Meanwhile Vel'Koz cries in a corner.

Basically, but who feels sorry for Vel'Koz?  That guy has been a sleeper since forever.

> [{quoted}](name=TheGoddessDiana,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=T4RbHftx,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-02-04T09:11:58.841+0000)
>

> Meanwhile Vel'Koz cries in a corner.

well here's the funny thing about that. They announced they would be changing velkoz up a bit so that he would be better, and then everyone lost their shit at the mere thought, because apparently 3 skill shots, a stacking passive that just deals more damage, and a stand-in-place ult is super exciting!

I also like how you are talking about how tahm was fine at release and was overbuffed, illao is going to be the same, meanwhile velkoz "cries in a corner", which I'm taking you to mean that he's on the weaker side (I agree with you), but at the same time everyone also cried that velkoz is perfectly balanced

I'm not disagreeing with you or anything, because, in fact, I agree with you. I just think it's funny how people who don't know what their talking about always come out to disagree with literally every opinion always.

> [{quoted}](name=Totalis,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=T4RbHftx,comment-id=00010004,timestamp=2016-02-04T21:47:18.131+0000)
> a stand-in-place ult is super exciting!

Dude

You have no idea what it's like to be on the giving end of that laser.

It's... invigorating...
http://i.imgur.com/AqnRut5.gif?Noredirect

The same is going to happen to Illaoi. 

Dear god no. If this happens we will soon be seing supportlois.
already a thing.
And now he got overnerfed lol
and it the nerfs weren't even in his damage output like they needed to be in.

Never mind the part where his "second health bar" is either only worth 25-40% of its value (regen), or worth 100% but only for a few seconds (shield). Oh, and his grey health doesn't regenerate unless you leave him alone; same deal as Garen, only more limited because he can only regen the grey health.

Never mind that it is entirely possible in the laning phase to NOT let him hit you three times in a row, or that his only hard CC relies on this. Unlike, say, Blitzcrank's one-hit pull that can move you further than Tahm ever could, or Taric's point-n-click stun. (Had a game as Tahm where in the first 8+ minutes I couldn't land 3 stacks on either enemy player without blowing Q, because they knew not to let him close the gap). He stacks by AAing, which draws minion aggro, meaning that to proc stacks he has to tank the entire minion wave.

Never mind that his ult is cancelled so easily that a Tahm facing average-IQ or higher opponents generally shouldn't be able to use it in the middle of combat (seriously, a single AA will stop it). Oh, and he roots himself while channeling it, so try using those skillshot abilities.

Never mind that he scales best by stacking health as a defensive stat, which is countered by both a staple ADC item {{item:3153}} and a situational pick {{item:3034}} / {{item:3036}}.

Never mind that outside of the aforementioned easily cancelled ult, he has no mobility. None.

Never mind that his Q can be blocked by minions; the same defense that is widely agreed to be acceptable counterplay for Blitzcrank.

tl;dr Don't play aggressively, and if he pops his shield wait it out. Don't blow your CC on the ADC if Tahm's standing right there. Don't run from him in a straight line. And for the love of God, if you're melee and his Devour is off CD don't just stand there like an idiot swapping AAs.

{{item:3153}}  hasn't been a staple item in a while, it got nerfed bad. Hell the guys who used to build that every game {{champion:11}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:39}} often just ignore it entirely for rageblade, it's that useless.

I still see it on ADCs, who would be the ones facing support Tahm early-mid game. And if the ADC is unwilling to change their build to accommodate the threat, they deserve to lose.

If this means BORK has to be buffed slightly, so be it.

Him 3 hitting and eating you is fine with me...because if you get hit by tahm 3 times and get eaten, you probably didn't have the best position. He does, however, deal quite a bit of damage for being as tanky as he is (ie all juggernauts, nothing new). The annoying this is his ability to save people lol.
i hate that his perma slow devoure rinse and repeat makes it impossible to run away from him.
Well obviously he's going to be sticky, otherwise he would just get like 2 stacks and run after you like COME BACK
I know right, thank goodness they nerfed garens stickiness in all departments but give tom his near permaslow and devour~ {{sticker:zombie-nunu-hearts}}
Have you ever tried to stick to people with Trynd or Olaf?

a hero with a gapcloser and a slow as long as you know to use it when they flee from you, and a guy with a ranged slow that becomes spammable in most chase situations, as well as cc invulnerability? 

Both of these are harder to peel then a Garen. the question I submit to you is have YOU ever tried to stick to people with a Garen?

> [{quoted}](name=MunchCrunchLunch,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=T4RbHftx,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2016-02-04T13:10:07.222+0000)
>
> i hate that his perma slow devoure rinse and repeat makes it impossible to run away from him.

The exact same thing that ryze got nerfed for. Perma CC.
and if he buys{{item:3116}}

> [{quoted}](name=Von Revanchist,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=T4RbHftx,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-02-04T08:49:57.695+0000)
>
>Another thing that is great about tahm is his passive that gives him 2 life bars!
>
>Passive

Welp, it turns out you've never played the champion you're complaining about.

Like with all champions, if you think it's OP, oppressive and ridiculous, play him, see what makes him tick.

hmm? No, it says its a passive on his E
Maybe OP should have said "one of" his passives?
I dont really understand how that was a misunderstanding for you.

Because his passive doesn't give him two lifebars, it's the actual E active that does. 

It's an activated ability with a short duration, you might as well stop hitting him entirely and do something else, he'll be out of shield in like 4 seconds anyways.

It has -plenty- of counterplay, but if you keep acting like it's volibear passive and hitting him through the duration of the shield, it's clear you've never played the guy.

This ^

I'd rather wait for that second bar to fade  by itself than fighting a Tryn or Mundo's ult. You don't even need to burn all your cc, it's not that hard ffs

Nope.
E's Passive creates the lifebar
E Active turns it into armor

So his passive is giving him two life bars.
Tahm Kench literally has 3 passives
To be fair his actual passive is just "When Tahm Kench hits something, that something gets a fish counter" it does nothing by itself but actually enable his spells.
"I slam my fists on my desk in celebration!!!!"
I'm okay with Tahm Kench.
Any ranged support dumpsters Tahm.
maybe for the first few levels till he gets a health item. Then he becomes I DONT GIVE A FUCK TAHM. I play him as of late and I eat everyone equally.

@Riot:
What you do to Balance the Kench is simple. Remove the stacks if he procced the third hit and give it a 5 second cooldown. (Similar to Yasuos dash cooldown on its targets). Congratz, you can escape Tahm Kench now, unlike in his current state. Because right now if he can proc this passive you are pretty much dead or have to back due to low HP.

> [{quoted}](name=MadKnife IV,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=T4RbHftx,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2016-02-04T15:35:34.728+0000)
>
> @Riot:
> What you do to Balance the Kench is simple. Remove the stacks if he procced the third hit and give it a 5 second cooldown. (Similar to Yasuos dash cooldown on its targets). Congratz, you can escape Tahm Kench now, unlike in his current state. Because right now if he can proc this passive you are pretty much dead or have to back due to low HP.

That would be stupid, that means he then has to wait 5 seconds to use his W, only should prevent stuns not building stacks
A more balanced idea would be to have an empowered Q or offensive W consume all stacks.
Offensive W already consumes all stacks.

Worst part is how he can eat any high priority target and just run like fucking wind. Immobile ADC who got caught out, with flash and heal down from a previous mistake? No worries, my flash is yours! Also, I have 2 fucking healthbars and a speedboost for eating you, so there's basically no way the enemy can lock us down, kill me, and then move on to you. Basically Kayle, except he doesn't fucking die, at all.

He can only "run like fucking wind" _towards_ enemies. He no longer gets a movement speed boost when running away with someone in his belly. With that gone, trying to pluck away an ally like you described is often bound to result in two kills for them rather than one. Why? I'm immobile. If I don't have flash and/or you have hard CC, I'm boned, since I can't E or flash in order to whisk us away from danger. I used to have a half dozen close saves per match, but now I stick mostly to enemy devour since, in most cases, ally devour puts Tahm at too much risk. Likewise, with the nerfs to his E, it's nowhere near "2 fucking healthbars" anymore. It decays faster now.

Does Riot need to cripple Tahm for people to stop the circle-jerk complaint threads? He currently sits at 46.26% for support (22nd out of 25) and 48.41% for top (36th out of 56). Literally the only positive attribute that stands out when looking at his stats anymore is he's near the top in damage taken, yet is also near the top in not dying. His damage is mediocre (or worse) and, like I said, the removal of that MS boost while running away makes ally often put him at nearly equal risk, something I saw everyone clamoring for.

If you just don't like the very idea of a champion having an ally Zhonyas built into his kit, just say so. Because, at this point, it's clearly no longer about him being too strong. If you think it is, you're out of your skull.
Gee, I wonder why Riot doesn't give a Zhonya to ADCs. Maybe because something like that would be too strong? That's what this fucker {{champion:223}}  is lol

Tbh what a typical adc wants is to freely auto for as long as possible, that's why they make good use of {{item:3139}} . Mages love Zhonya because it lets them win some time for cd's to come up again and throw another wave of spells.
Can I touch Tahm Kench's belly
i used to think ~~katarina was ~~ blitz,tahm,illaoi were gods, but i learned to ~~cc~~ dodge

I especially love how quick his tongue can hit me. It also has such a "generous" hitbox. Champion design PERFECTION, OMGosh!

{{sticker:zombie-nunu-hearts}}
